bunpro.meaning: May not … but (at least), Even though not, Even if not
bunpro.writeup: ないまでもis a combination of the negated form of a verb, the case-marking particle まで 'until', and theadverbial particleも 'even'. It will often be translated as 'even though not (A), (B)', or 'it may not be (A), but (B)'. This structure usually presents some form of extreme (A) which has not yet been reached, but the lower extent of (B) cannot be denied. The literal translation is 'even though not reaching (A), (B)'.Depending on the source, this structure may occasionally be used with nouns. In this case, it will need to follow ではない, or the casual じゃない.This grammar pattern will be used in both positive and negative situations. For example, (A) may be the best outcome, where (B) is something just below that which is desirable, or (A) may be the worst outcome, where (B) is just below that, but still quite bad.Often, the (B) phrase will express some kind of wish or demand that the speaker wants to meet with structures like たい, てほしい, てください, たらどう, つもり, といい, etc.

examples.japanese: この作品は名作だとは言えないまでも、なかなかいい作品だと思う。
examples.english: This may not be a masterpiece, but I think that it is a pretty good piece.

examples.japanese: 犯罪などは完全になくせないまでも、減らすように頑張るべきだ。
examples.english: Even though it may not be possible to eliminate crime, we should try our best to reduce it.

examples.japanese: プロ野球選手にはなれないまでも、プロ野球に関わる仕事をしているので満足している。
examples.english: Even though I can't become a professional baseball player, I am satisfied because my job is related to professional baseball.

examples.japanese: 毎週ではないまでも、娘に会えるだけ幸せだ。
examples.english: I'm just happy to see my daughter, even if it's not every week.

examples.japanese: 好きな仕事ができないから幸せじゃないまでも、生活費に困っていないから文句は言えない。
examples.english: Even though I can't do what I love for work, I can't complain because I am not struggling with my bills.

examples.japanese: ファンタジー小説：「勇者えみりあを仲間にしないまでも、一度は会ってみたらどうですか?」
examples.english: Fantasy novel: 'You may not make hero Emilia into an ally, but what about meeting her at least once?'

examples.japanese: これは不可能ではないまでも、実行するのは困難である。
examples.english: This may not be impossible, but carrying it out is hard.

examples.japanese: 急速充電はバッテリーを直ちに駄目にしないまでも、性能をより速く低下させる。
examples.english: Fast charging may not immediately damage the battery, but it will decrease its performance faster.

examples.japanese: リザ「大谷は一番ハンサムといわないまでも、かなりカッコいい男だと思うよ。」
examples.english: Riza 'I won't say that Ooya is the most handsome, but I think he is quite a cool guy.'

examples.japanese: 初めてJLPTN1を受験したが、合格できないまでも、せめて８０点は得点できたい。
examples.english: I took the JLPT N1 exam for the first time, I may not pass, but at least I want to get 80 points.

dojg.description: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
dojg.meaning: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not

examples.japanese: (ksa).この公演は大成功とは言えないまでも、それなりの成果をもたらした。
examples.english: Although you may not be able to call this public performance a  great success, it produced results of a sort.

examples.japanese: (ksb).彼の論文は決して多くないまでも、その質は非常に高い。
examples.english: Although he hasn't published many papers at all, the quality  (of those he has published) is extremely high.

examples.japanese: (a).「生命とはこういうものです」とは言えないまでも、「少なくともこうではありません」とは言えるようになってくるはずだ。
examples.english: We may not be able to say, “This is what life is,” but we  should come to a point where we can say, “At least this is what it isn't.”

examples.japanese: (b).その彫刻は完璧とは言えないまでも、非常に可能性を感じさせる作品だった。
examples.english: The sculpture may not be called a perfect work, but it is (literally:  was) a work that makes you feel unusual potential.

examples.japanese: (c).虚偽だとは言わないまでも、かなり紛らわしい表現だ。
examples.english: I can't go so far as to call this wording deceptive, but it  sure is misleading.

examples.japanese: (d).中国語は漢字だから、読めないまでも意味はなんとなく分かるのだが、韓国語はまったく見当がつかない。
examples.english: If it were written in Chinese I could get a sense of what it's  saying because of the characters, even though I cannot read it, but I cannot  make heads or tails of Korean.

examples.japanese: (e).インターネットは完璧ではないまでも、生涯学習もしくは生涯教育のメディアとして、いろいろな可能性をもっています。
examples.english: The Internet is not perfect, but it does have various possibilities  as a medium for lifelong learning and/or teaching.

examples.japanese: (f).運命には逆らえないまでも、それを味方にすることはできる。
examples.english: We may not be able to turn back Fate, but we can make it our  friend.

examples.japanese: (g).大方の日本人なら、「源氏物語」の原文に目を通したとまではいかないまでも、どんな話なのかは知っているだろう。
examples.english: I believe most Japanese, even though they may not have read the  original Tale of Genji, know the basic plot of the story.

examples.japanese: (h).明日は天気がよくないまでも、気温はあまり低くなりません。
examples.english: Although the weather may not be good, the temperature will not  drop much.

examples.japanese: (i).彼は正直者じゃないまでも、嘘つきじゃない。
examples.english: He may not be an honest person, but he isn't a liar.

dojg.formation:
## 

- (i)Vnegative
- ないまでも
- 行かないまでも
- Someone may not go there, but
- しないまでも
- Someone may not do something, but
- (ii)Adjectiveいstemく
- ないまでも
- よくないまでも
- Something may not be good, but
- (iii){Adjectiveなstem/ Noun}
- {では/じゃ}ないまでも
- 元気{では/じゃ}ないまでも
- Someone may not be peppy/healthy, but
- 病気{では/じゃ}ないまでも
- Someone may not be ill, but
dojg.part_of_speech: Phrase (usually used in formal writing and formal speech)
